TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed Wrapping extends System.Enum

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Specifies how rendered text is wrapped. This class cannot be inherited. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Various wrapping modes are only supported on certain devices. See information about device-specific rendering of styles for details.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping NotSet = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Default value. If the value is , then whether a control wraps or not is inherited from the control's style, or, if the style is not defined, from the control's parent control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping NoWrap = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Text is not wrapped. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Wrapping Wrap = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Text is wrapped at the margins of a screen or a container. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
